intro: Iridorkis imbricata, commonly known as the mountain iris, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Iridorkis imbricata typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
